pullRequest.body:
co-authored by: @jjaassoonn 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [c672292339](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20968/commits/c67229233905f662c1190c35e89a868a6fc39c21)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.BrauerGroup.Defs` (new file)|1352|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Brauer.CSA_Setoid:`
`+ BrauerEquivalence`
`+ BrauerGroup`
`+ CSA`
`+ IsBrauerEquivalent`
`+ instance : CoeSort (CSA.{u, v} K) (Type v) := ⟨(·.carrier)⟩`
`+ is_eqv`
`+ refl`
`+ symm`
`+ trans`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Can you extend `AlgebraCat.{v} K` here? That gives you the first three fields for free.
okay!
after adding the `AlgebraCat` the `CoeSort` instance failed...
Using `(·.carrier)` instead of `CSA.carrier` should fix that.

There is [CategoryTheory.FullSubcategory](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/FullSubcategory.html#CategoryTheory.FullSubcategory) but I don't think people normally consider CSAs as forming a category.
thanks! done!
This isn't part of your english description; are you  sure it is needed?
sorry I should include them in my description
This is definitely needed otherwise every algebra is equivalent to each other :((
Done!

This is the Lean 3 style:
```suggestion
  iso : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) A ≃ₐ[K] Matrix (Fin m) (Fin m) B
```
(and throughout)

Shorter as
```suggestion
attribute [instance] BrauerEquivalence.hn BrauerEquivalence.hm
```
similarly throughout.

This seems rather fundamental! If you don't have this result yet, can I suggest you reframe the work below as "define the category of finite-dimensional central simple algebras"? I believe that the group becomes `Skeleton (CSACat K)`, and you get the abelian monoid structure in the same way we get it for `QuadraticModuleCat`.
I already have the results! I could delete them :))

My comment is less about whether you have the results, and more that actually the content of this PR is secretly just building the category I mention, and it would be better to be up front about doing that in how the lean code is written.

I think you'll get quite a lot of results for "free" if you lay the groundwork in this direction.
What's the morphism for this `CSACat K`? If it is algebra isomorphism, then the skeleton is not `BrauerGroup` because it's the quotient of `BrauerEquivalence` which is more general?

Surely you want to define BrauerGroup for commutative (semi)rings now that you've introduced Azumaya algebras? We'd need to use endomorphism algebras of faithfully projective modules rather than nontrivial matrix algebras though.
```suggestion
We introduce the definition of Brauer group of a field K, which is the quotient of the set of
all finite-dimensional central simple algebras over K modulo the Brauer Equivalence where two
central simple algebras `A` and `B` are Brauer Equivalent if there exist `n, m ∈ ℕ+` such
that the `Mₙ(A) ≃ₐ[K] Mₙ(B)`.
```
Yes I will but I've already finished one project on Brauer Group over a field and getting that into mathlib is currently my priority, but I'll work to prove that as well!

That's okay, but please add it as a TODO. A compromise is to use a definition that works for general commutative rings, but prove the rest of the results only over fields. This way the extra work you need to do is just showing every CSA is Azumaya (for which you just need that a tensor product of CSAs over the center is simple), and every faithfully projective module (assumed to be finite per Farb--Dennis) over a field is a nonzero finite dimensional vector space.

For this we do need to use the notion of Morita equivalence over a base field/commutative ring, which is now in #20632: see https://mathoverflow.net/questions/344673/are-azumaya-algebras-of-trivial-brauer-class-isomorphic-to-mathcalend-mathc#comment1183423_344684

the official PR is actually #20640, I have a WIP branch on mathlib called `azumaya_wip` that's gonna be about proving azumaya algebras on fields aare indeed central simple algebras but a lot prerequists are yet to implement,
optimistically speaking that part of content is about 2-3 PRs away?
I believe you can now drop these and Lean finds them anyway.
Done!

```suggestion
# Definition of Brauer group of a field K
```
This is how you say it in the first line below.
This should be extracted to `def BrauerEquivalence.trans`
It's one line, but this may as well be called `BrauerEquivalence.symm`
okay one sec
I'm curious if there's a construction  here that produces smaller matrices; is `lcm p n` sufficient instead of `p * n`?
(I think you'd need this result if you wanted to show that `BrauerEquivalent` forms a Groupoid)
yeah `lcm` would also work but I chose p*n just to save time

```suggestion
  /-- Any member of `CSA` is central. -/
```

```suggestion
that `Mₙ(A) ≃ₐ[K] Mₙ(B)`.
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Mathlib/Algebra/BrauerGroup/Defs): define Brauer Equivalence and Brauer Group
